scenarioDescription:
The TOI-540 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-540 is a star with 0.16 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.19 times its radius. It is located 45.67 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.1 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TOI-540 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-540 system


TOI-540 b

TOI-540 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2020-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-540 b is 0.674 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-540 b is 0.903 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, TOI-540 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TOI-540, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-540 - System With 1 Exoplanet
